BIC:
> Okay, so what I got ta tell ya is I think he's plann'n an all out =
assault on you guys, like tryn' ta take this place for the Maximals and Aut=
obots. Wants ta level the fortress ta the ground. What I think we gotta do =
is beat 'em at his own game. And he knows we're gonna try'n get at the Ark,=
 and if we go there, we're done for. See? It's not easy gettn' around the g=
uy because he ain't your average scrap heap. He don't think like an average=
 Autobot. So, if I were you guys, that shell program you got gon' on, I thi=
nk ya better have a bot make a backup of that'n hold onto it. Because he's =
gonna try'n blow this place sky high, and everything with it. And as far as=
 I know he'll be barrelln' in here with the rest of his posse any time now.=
"
>
> Of course he was telling them a complete lie, hoping they'd buy it. H=
is tone shows no indication of telling a fib. Inside he was hoping that his=
 idea mixed with Tucson's would take hold.

Scorponok nodded thoughtfully a=
nd attentively as Nightshift talked,
his optic getting a speculative hue to=
 them. "How does Tuscon expect
to accomplish his task?" the large Predacon =
asked, his voice betraying
only a few misgivings about Nightshift and his s=
tory. "The Maximals
have to know that this fortress can be made near impreg=
nable should
Hydras command it."

As Nightshift talked of the shell program=
 Scorponok's musing attitude
became sharp as he looked back at the mech. "T=
he shell program is well
protected." He said, obviously his suspicions comm=
ing once again into
focus. "And with all of us here, there is no way that h=
e could take us
all. He already arttempted to break in here once, and he fa=
iled. It
would be foolish for him to try again."

Scorponok's optics narrow=
 as he watched Nightshift, "Unless of course
there is something that you ar=
e holding back from us . . . " Scorponok
let the question hang in the air a=
s he waited for Nightshift's
response, along with the potentially disastero=
us result should
Nightshift answer wrongly.

(TAG)
